723368f.text:
181-183, 185-187 Spring Street, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Thompson Street. The two small buildings at the corner are frame, faced with brick on the Spring Street side.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 300.
723368f.folder: Spring Street & Thompson Street, Manhattan, NY

723508f-a.text:
88 Thompson Street, an old frame house adjoining the N.E. corner of
Spring Street.
1932..
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 546.
723508f-a.folder: Thompson Street & Spring Street, Manhattan, NY

723370f-a.text:
182 to 19b Spring Street, south side, from Thompson Street towards Sullivan Street. The corner building, at the left, is not quite all shown. The three small houses in the center are Nos. 186,
188, 190.
June 7, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
723370f-a.folder: Spring Street & Thompson Street, Manhattan, NY

723369f-a.text:
Spring Street (right), north side, east from Thompson Street (left) and across West Broadway (6th Ave. Elevated Line thereon). To the left appears a small 3 story structure, No. 88 Thompson Street, that is constructed of wood with a metal sheath.
May 7, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.

The same, from a different angle.
P. L. Sperr.
April 25, 1939.
723369f-a.folder: Spring Street & Thompson Street, Manhattan, NY

723369f-b.text:
Spring Street (right), north side, east from Thompson Street (left) and across West Broadway (6th Ave. Elevated Line thereon). To the left appears a small 3 story structure, No. 88 Thompson Street, that is constructed of wood with a metal sheath.
May 7, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.

The same, from a different angle.
P. L. Sperr.
April 25, 1939.
723369f-b.folder: Spring Street & Thompson Street, Manhattan, NY

723509f-a.text:
(1) Thompson Street, west side, at, adjoining, and north of the N.W. corner of Spring Street, showing 181 Spring Street at the corner (it has no Thompson Street house number) and 87 Thompson Street, two doors north, both old frame houses. No. 181 Spring Street is faced with brick. Judging from the decorations in Thompson Street, an Italian saint's-day festival has been going on. 1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2) The same, eleven years later, after the demolition of No. 87 Thompson Street, the frame house which adjoined the five-story  garage (formerly stable). June 7, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
723509f-a.folder: Thompson Street & Spring Street, Manhattan, NY

723509f-b.text:
(1) Thompson Street, west side, at, adjoining, and north of the N.W. corner of Spring Street, showing 181 Spring Street at the corner (it has no Thompson Street house number) and 87 Thompson Street, two doors north, both old frame houses. No. 181 Spring Street is faced with brick. Judging from the decorations in Thompson Street, an Italian saint's-day festival has been going on. 1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2) The same, eleven years later, after the demolition of No. 87 Thompson Street, the frame house which adjoined the five-story  garage (formerly stable). June 7, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
723509f-b.folder: Thompson Street & Spring Street, Manhattan, NY

723510f-a.text:
Thompson Street, north from Spring Street, showing a clearance at the N.W. corner upon which stood several old frame houses. This area, populated by Italians predominantly, retains a more or less universal feature ascribed to this nationality, a local street market.
May 7, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
723510f-a.folder: Thompson Street & Spring Street, Manhattan, NY

723511f-a.text:
99 Thompson Street, west side, between Spring and Prince Streets.

Photo by J. J. Corell 1896
P. L. Sperr Collection
723511f-a.folder: Thompson Street & Spring Street, Manhattan, NY

723512f-a.text:
102-04, 106 and 108 Thompson Street, east side, between Spring and Prince Streets, showing only the lower portions of buildings enumerated,with a street market in front of same. This area, populated by individuals of Italian extraction find their retail necessities well supplied by this local feature, of which this view shows only a portion.
May 7, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
723512f-a.folder: Thompson Street & Spring Street, Manhattan, NY
